page.title: 06PUBLIC SERVICES IN A-J-M
page.content: All dwellings in the region are supplied with{electricity}from the National Grid, but there is{no gas supply. The houses all have{mains {water}but no mains drainage. The farms and houses each have or share a{septic {tank}which processes all waste water. Nearly every house has a telephone,but there is no public phonebox. The {postman}delivers mail once a day and collects twice a day from local mail- boxes. The local policeman does not live in the survey area, but is from Worleston. The population have to travel to Crewe or Nantwich for {medical and dental services.}The nearest hospital is Leighton Hospital, just Northeast of Aston-juxta-Mondrum.
